abstract: Britain’s six big banks are set to come together next week to donate close to £1 billion ($1.6 billion) into a venture capital fund with the aim of bridging the “equity gap,” putting small businesses in a better position to seek a bank loan, The Financial Times reported.
snippet: Britain’s six big banks are set to come together next week to donate close to £1 billion ($1.6 billion) into a venture capital fund with the aim of bridging the “equity gap,” putting small businesses in a better position to seek a bank loan, The F...
lead_paragraph: Britain’s six big banks are set to come together next week to donate close to £1 billion ($1.6 billion) into a venture capital fund with the aim of bridging the “equity gap,” putting small businesses in a better position to borrow money from banks, The Financial Times reported.

headline.main: British Banks Said to Plan $1.6 Billion for Fund
